project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the default unit for time if the user does not enter a time suffix (d, h, m, etc.) is minutes. Our users are used to entering their hours in hours so we are having a lot of problems with people just entering 5 and thinking it means 5 hours when in reality, they have entered 5 minutes. 

We need the ability to either set the default entry without a suffix to another unit (hours) or to set time tracking fields so an entry without a suffix is invalid, forcing the user to enter a suffix.
fields.summary: Add ability to set default time unit for work logs through GH interface or flag time entry with no unit as invalid

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Today Greenhopper only shows the required fields from a transition screen when performing a workflow action. I my case, I want the developer to write a comment when a issue is dragged from "in progress" into "to do", meaning progress has stopped, as well as updating the priority (put it to blocker, if the issue is blocked etc.).

Transition screens should be honoured in greenhopper as well. In stead of having a customized transition screen from GH, maybe have a option to use a iframe popping the JIRA transition screen. 

This issue was created after a forum post here: http://www.greenpeppersoftware.com/site/posts/list/405.page
fields.summary: As a developer, I would like to see the comment field in my transition if this one is in the transition screen since this one cannot be required but is very often used.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. In project admin, set team assignees based on component
2. Open the Planning Board or Task Board view
3. Click the "Add sub-task" button on a task with the component set
4. Enter the task and click "Create and close"

Observed:
The component of the sub-task is set to the component of the parent task but the assignment for the newly created task is the project default, not the component default. When I create a new sub-task in JIRA (and assign the component manually) it automatically assigns the sub-task to the component lead correctly.  

Expected:
The sub-task should be assigned to the component lead that is passed from the parent task to the sub-task.
fields.summary: Team Lead assignment is not applied when creating sub-tasks from Planning Board or Task Board

"
I go to Administrtion -> Custom fields and cant' find there my early created field for Rank Sorting. When I try to make another one I received my new field and the old one is appear. So I have two fields with Rank Type.  I've found the same error in this issue: https://63.246.22.60/browse/JRA-10396

What I am doing wrong?

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have developers that have used the Jira subtask UI to enter subtasks on an issue - hence the Fix/Version field is unscheduled while the Parent story is assigned to a Jira version appropriately.

When we click "Synchronize Fix / Versions", it reports that "All versions are syncronized" even though there are several stories that have subtasks with version info that do not match the parent story.

Also I thought greenhopper was supposed to do this automatically or when you manually click "Synchronize Fix / Versions" ...do we have a configuration problem - e.g. maybe we didn't configure the listener's properly?
Strangely enough SOME of the stories do have sub-task with matching version info - it only effects some stories and I can't find a pattern as to why.   

See attached screenshot that shows some stories that have subtasks, but those subtasks are not displayed in the task board because they do not have a matching fix/version.
fields.summary: Synchronize Fix / Versions doesn't work for us

fields.description:
I thought we had this nailed, but have upgraded to GH 3.3 on Jira 3.10 and it is still occurring. 

Users using IE6 cannot look at cards in list view on the task board. They can use the card view to get around it, but this is not ideal.

Also, quite often the task board and/or the planning board will hang in IE6 (regardless of the view type) with the IEXPLORE.EXE CPU utilization in the Task Manaager exceeding 50%. Only way to fix is to close IE via Task Manager.

All works fine in Firefox 3.x, but unfortunately corporate SOE users are stuck with IE6 currently.

Can supply more documentation if required.
fields.summary: Task Board Hangs/Displays Incorrectly in IE6

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In the task board, if I click user preferences icon and change the # of cards/column to a different number, and then click "save and apply" then "close" - all of cards in the "To Do" column show a strikethrough line through the number, as if the Jira issues were resolved/closed (and of course in the ToDo column they all are open)  Clicking "rehresh" in the taskboard (upper right corner) clears the strikethrough lines which makes them look nornmal.  

Tip: If I do not click "close" in the user preferences after clicking "save and apply", I cannot get the strikethrough lines to be cleared, even by clicking refresh.  I must click "close" 1st and then "refresh"

This is causing our new teams a bunch of confusion - would be nice to get a fix.
fields.summary: In task board, changing the # of cards displayed, causes all Jira issue #s in ToDo column to show as "resolved", until you click "refresh" in greenhopper

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The use case is quite often I just want to reduce the task board (regardless of the active context) to view to those issues assigned only to me and  then as needed, switch to seeing all issues within the active  context.  A simple check box next to "Auto assign" would work on the task board main screen.

I don't want to have to create 2 contexts for every context I have now  - one for "Planning - My issues" and 1 for "Planning - All issues", "Default - My issues" and 1 for "Default - All issues",etc.

Frankly it would be a great checkbox to see on the planning board too  as well as the task board.

If this confuses some GH users, maybe allow the display of this  checkbox to be controlled via configuration .
fields.summary: As a developer, I need a quick access to the "Assigned to me" checkbox independently from the current context

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently to see if a story or bug is being worked on within a sprint, I need to expand every issue and look to see if any of their subtasks are in progress.  I wish Greenhopper would instead mark any parent issue as "In Progress" if any 1 of the subtasks are in progress or closed.  Only parent issues with no subtasks or parent issues with all open subtasks would show in the "Open" status.  

This way I could glance at the issues and quickly see which ones we should drill into - e.g. I could review all stories that have not been started at all, review stories that are in progress but not yet closed. 

Likewise I'd like an *option* that I could turn on to automatically resolve or close the parent issue when the last sub task was closed.

- In GH Planning Board config, set the Story Points to be shown in the List view of the Version Board (Default issue type of Bug is shown)

- Go to the Planning Board Overview where you have at least one SubTask and you get this error:

ue/list/issue-list.vm at  [35,5]

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We often want to see a burn down chart, planning board and/or task board for multiple JIRA releases at once.

The reason is
* We are obliged to create a JIRA release for each code cut that goes to certain environments (so we can produce change notes)
* Therefore in a sprint we normally number it 1.1.x and we will increment the X for each deployment to an environment

So for burndown we actually want to track all the 1.1.x releases. 

The simplest way would be implemented as an 'All' option in the releases drop down and we will just create a stored filter to limit it to the release.

Alternatively it could be implement allowing multiple selection of release versions.
fields.summary: Ability to select multiple releases for a burn down chart

fields.summary: Perm Gen Space error

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The JIRA timetracking feature allows to specify how many days per week are work days, and I have it set to 5 days.
In Israel, 5 days work week starts on Sunday and ends on Thursday, unlike most countries where Sunday is the day off.

When looking at GreenHopper burn down charts - the non-working days are automatically set to Saturday and Sunday, and it's just plain wrong.
I could not find any way to make GH think otherwise.

Would be nice if there was a configuration item where first day of the week can be chosen, either Sunday or Monday.
fields.summary: GreenHopper assumes that 5 days a week means Monday to Friday

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Using Greenhopper 3.1.1, and the new print view.
When I print the cards, the background color doesn't print.  The cards show correctly on my screen, but print on a white background.  I have a nice fancy color printer, would love to be able to take advantage of the nice color.

My environment:
Safari 3.2, Mac 10.5.5, Jira 3.13
fields.summary: Printing cards include background color

fields.description: I was happy to find customization capabilities so that I could define a context that filtered down to just issue assigned to me :). It is a convenient view for work planning and status.  However, quite a few of our developers work on more than one project including (and especially) me!  We also have some project managers that manage a few related projects in concert.  Could there be a way to have related projects in one taskboard?  A manager could get a multi-project taskboard and developers could define a context for only their items across related projects.
fields.summary: Taskboards across projects

fields.description: Unfortunately, when JIRA implemented improve worklog features a few releases back, they missed putting support in for classifying work types - see [JRA-1780|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-1780].  Kaamelot adds this support. The request is for green hopper to recognize if work log type capability is available in the installation and add it to the card based log work screens.  Without type classification, our users will not be able to use this capability, in fact, it will be frustrating for them to see the capability there to easily add work logs, but not be able to do so.  Our process requires the field be set and invalid entries would need to be repaired by the user.
fields.summary: Add worklog type to log work

fields.description:
In the Issue Navigator, if I export the results of a search as XML, then the value of the Rank field for each issue is reported as "NONE".

I am using the XML report as a means for interfacing to Jira, and all the other information I need is there!  Has the GreenHopper Ranking field type defined how to render itself in XML?  I see there was a similar issue with the Excel export function and while back, now fixed.

fields.description:
Occasionally our users are getting the following exception while creating an issue in a Greenhopper project in our Jira. At first glance it seems to have to do with the Rank field. It doesn't happen often, and I've been unable to reproduce it personally, but it's happened at least 4 separate times to different users in different projects. The issue is not created when this exception is thrown, but the user is then able to re-submit the form and create the issue successfully. Any ideas?

fields.description:
We use Fix Versions as a multiple select field. If we commit a fix to some common code that is used in an upcoming release for siteA.com and siteB.com we want this issue to have Fix Versions siteA.com Release 23 and siteB.com Release 58 for example. If I for some reason move this issue from siteB.com Release 58 -> siteB.com Release 59, GreenHopper wipes out the siteA.com Release 23 Fix Version I had set.

GH should look at where you're moving from when determining how to update the Fix Version field. If moving issue from siteB.com Release 58 -> siteB.com Release 59, remove the siteB.com Release 58 Fix Version and add the siteB.com Release 59 Fix Version, don't wipe all of them and reset it. 

This is the main blocker for us and is why we didn't purchase GreenHopper but rather just using what JIRA offers.
fields.summary: Moving an issue from one sprint to another should intelligently replace Fix Versions, not wipe them out completely

fields.description:
We send links commonly to customers.  Since GreenHopper seems to use session information (which is convenient for internal users), we cannot send a link to the planning board for a specific version i.e. Unscheduled.

# A permanent link may be copied from the version header in the planning board
# A user with no session may receive a link and it will allow them to view issues in a planning board for a specific version.
fields.summary: Need permanent links to planning board for each version.
